intro: Psychotria sciaphila subsp. longicalyx, commonly known as the long-leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elongated leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stem. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which are followed by small, round berries. This species is often found in shaded understory environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
